results.title: California Fires Take a Deep Toll on Wine Country
results.abstract: Beyond the financial cost of the destruction in Napa Valley is the emotional price, as wine that’s been nurtured from vineyard to barrel flows down the drain.

multimedia.caption: Red grapes scorched by fires at Chateau Boswell in St. Helena, Calif. Many Napa wineries had not completed their harvest before the fires struck.

results.title: It’s Time for Diners to Ask the Servers: How Are You Doing?
results.abstract: As indoor dining returns to New York, the danger to restaurant workers increases. So does the need to protect them.

results.title: Jim Murray, a Top Whiskey Critic, Faces Accusations of Sexism
results.abstract: Several distillers and retailers have severed ties to the British writer, after complaints surfaced about the treatment of women in his books and at events.

des_facet: Coconut & Sambal: Recipes From My Indonesian Kitchen (Book)

results.title: James Helferich, Artist in the Food World and Prison Chef, Dies at 75
results.abstract: A classically trained cook, Mr. Helferich worked at marine theme parks in Florida, enthralling his co-workers with his skill as an ice and butter sculptor. He died of the novel coronavirus.

multimedia.caption: James Helferich was a master creater of ice and butter sculptures when he worked in the hospitality business. He later had a stint as a food services director for a Florida prison. He is shown with his daughter, Jessica.
